meanings.definition: Remove (someone) from a place of danger to a safe place.
meanings.sent1: During the fire drill, we had to evacuate the building quickly.
meanings.sent2: In case of a hurricane, it is important to evacuate coastal areas.
meanings.sent3: Why did the math book need to evacuate the library? It must have been too dangerous!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to evacuate all the tension from the room.
meanings.sent5: The emergency alarm blared, signaling us to evacuate the premises immediately.
